content.question: A hockey all-star game has the Eastern Division all-stars play against the Western Division all-stars. On the Eastern Division team there are 8 United States-born players, 14 Canadian-born players, and 2 European-born players. On the Western Division team there are 12 United States-born players, 8 Canadian-born players, and 4 European-born players. If one player is selected at random from the Eastern Division team and one player is selected at random from the Western Division team, what is the probability that neither player will be a Canadian-born player?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.6: Independent Events and Unions of Events

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
